UI_visible_response: Read 18 web pagesView Page DetailsChina has banned the use of organs from executed prisoners for transplantation since January 1, 2015. Since then, voluntary organ donation from the general public has become the only legitimate source for organ transplants. This change was implemented to align China's organ transplant practices with international ethical standards and to address concerns regarding human rights and the ethics of organ procurement.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: China has banned the use of organs from executed prisoners for transplantation since January 1, 2015[^2^][^3^]. Since then, voluntary organ donation from the general public has become the only legitimate source for organ transplants[^3^]. This change was implemented to align China's organ transplant practices with international ethical standards and to address concerns regarding human rights and the ethics of organ procurement[^2^].
